errorCategory.title: Styling references
errorCategory.shortUserDesc:
The used style(s) must refer to (an) existing
                style(s).
errorCategory.longUserDesc:
The style attribute refers to one or more style element which
                define(s) the formatting of the subtitle text. Referenced style elements must be
                descendants of a styling element.

specs.name: Timed Text Markup Language 1 (TTML1) (Second Edition), Version 2013-09-24
specs.text:
If specified, the value of a style attribute must adhere to the IDREFS
                    data type [...], and, furthermore, each IDREF must reference a style element
                    which has a styling element as an ancestor.

specs.name: Timed Text Markup Language 2 (TTML2) CR, Version 2018-03-13
specs.text:
If specified, the value of a style attribute must adhere to the IDREFS
                    data type [...], and, furthermore, each IDREF must reference a style element
                    which has a styling element as an ancestor.

specs.name: TTML Profiles for Internet Media Subtitles and Captions 1.0 (IMSC1), Version 2016-04-21
specs.text:
A Document Instance that conforms to a profile defined herein: SHALL satisfy
                all normative provisions specified by the profile; MAY include any vocabulary,
                syntax or attribute value associated with a Feature or Extension whose disposition
                is permitted in the profile; SHALL NOT include any vocabulary, syntax or attribute
                value associated with a Feature or Extension whose disposition is prohibited in the
                profile.

specs.name:
TTML Profiles for Internet Media Subtitles and Captions 1.0 (IMSC1) - Text
                Profile, Version 2016-04-21
specs.text:
The Text Profile consists of Sections 6. Common Constraints and 7. Text
                Profile Constraints.

specs.name: TTML Profiles for Internet Media Subtitles and Captions 1.0.1 (IMSC1), Version 2017-07-13
specs.text:
A Document Instance that conforms to a profile defined herein: SHALL satisfy
                all normative provisions specified by the profile; MAY include any vocabulary,
                syntax or attribute value associated with a Feature or Extension whose disposition
                is permitted or optional in the profile; SHALL NOT include any vocabulary, syntax or
                attribute value associated with a Feature or Extension whose disposition is
                prohibited in the profile.

specs.name:
TTML Profiles for Internet Media Subtitles and Captions 1.0.1 (IMSC1) - Text

specs.text:
The Text Profile consists of Sections 6. Common Constraints and 7. Text

specs.name: TTML Profiles for Internet Media Subtitles and Captions 1.1, Version 2017-10-17
specs.text:
A Document Instance that conforms to a profile defined herein: SHALL satisfy
                all normative provisions specified by the profile; MAY include any vocabulary,
                syntax or attribute value associated with a Feature or Extension whose disposition
                is permitted or optional in the profile; SHALL NOT include any vocabulary, syntax or
                attribute value associated with a Feature or Extension whose disposition is
                prohibited in the profile.

specs.name: TTML Profiles for Internet Media Subtitles and Captions 1.1 - Text Profile, Version 2017-10-17
specs.text:
The Text Profile consists of Sections 6. Supported Features and Extensions, 7.
                Common Provisions and 8. Text Profile Provisions.

specs.name: Netflix: Timed Text Style Guide: General Requirements, Version 2016-11-16
specs.text:
Subtitle and SDH files for all languages must be delivered in a TTML (.dfxp or
                .xml) format, except for Japanese, which must be delivered in Videotron Lambda Cap
                format.

                Error Information: The value of the attribute 'style' is 'textAlignCentre'.
messages.messageAssertion: The style attribute refers to an existing style.
messages.messageDiagnosticsAll: The value of the attribute 'style' is 'textAlignCentre'.

            <tt:span style="GreenOnBlack doubleHeight">Whoaaa!</tt:span>
         </tt:p>

errorCategory.title: No loop in style references
errorCategory.shortUserDesc:
There shall not be a loop in style
                references.
errorCategory.longUserDesc:
A loop in style references is present if it is possible, starting
                from a style S, to create a chain of styles that ends with S again, whereby each
                style in the chain refers to the following one via the style attribute. Such a loop
                is not allowed, as style property inheritance can never be resolved to a final
                value.

specs.name: Timed Text Markup Language 1 (TTML1) (Second Edition), Version 2013-09-24
specs.text:
A loop in a sequence of chained style references must be considered an
                    error.

specs.name: Timed Text Markup Language 2 (TTML2) CR, Version 2018-03-13
specs.text:
A loop in a sequence of chained style references must be considered an
                    error.

errorCategory.title: Undefined TTML attribute (TTML1)
errorCategory.shortUserDesc:
The attribute is within a TTML namespace, but it is not defined by
                the specification.
errorCategory.longUserDesc:
As the attribute is not defined by the specification, TTML
                processors/renderers may not have implemented support for the
                attribute.

specs.text:

                    catalog is enumerated in] Table 5 - Attribute Vocabulary.

errorCategory.title: Document encoding present
errorCategory.shortUserDesc:
It is common practice that a document encoding is specified in the
                XML declaration. Without this information the encoding can often not be determined
                and the constraints regarding document encoding (e.g. to just use UTF-8) could not
                be checked.

specs.name: TTML Profiles for Internet Media Subtitles and Captions 1.0 (IMSC1), Version 2016-04-21
specs.text:
A Document Instance SHALL use UTF-8 character encoding as specified in
                    UNICODE.

specs.name: TTML Profiles for Internet Media Subtitles and Captions 1.0.1 (IMSC1), Version 2017-07-13
specs.text:
A Document Instance SHALL use UTF-8 character encoding as specified in
                    UNICODE.

specs.name: TTML Profiles for Internet Media Subtitles and Captions 1.1, Version 2017-10-17
specs.text:
A Document Instance SHALL be [...] using the UTF-8 character encoding as
                    specified in [UNICODE].

errorCategory.title: tts:fontSize value
errorCategory.shortUserDesc:
The tts:fontSize attribute must be set to
                "100%".

specs.name: Netflix: Timed Text Style Guide: General Requirements, Version 2016-11-16
specs.text: tts:fontSize shall be defined as 100%.
